alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 3:31AM CDT until July 11 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN CANADIAN AND CENTRAL OKLAHOMA COUNTIES... At 331 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oklahoma City, southwestern Edmond, Midwest City, Del City, Yukon, Bethany, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village, Piedmont, Harrah, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park, Tinker Air Force Base, Newalla, Forest Park, Woodlawn Park and Lake Aluma. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
